name: Global.Intl.DateTimeFormat
summary: Immutable object used to generate localized date and time formatted strings.

methods.name: format
methods.summary: Formats the given date object to a localized date and/or time string.

methods.name: formatToParts
methods.summary: Formats given date to an array of components describing what the formmated string would produce.
methods.description:
Returns an array of objects providing the "type" and "value" of each component the formatted string would produce. Can be used to detect month/day/year ordering for the current locale, to fetch the localized separators between date and time components, etc.

For more detail, see the MDN website about formatToParts.

parameters.name: date
parameters.summary: The date to be formatted into parts.

returns.summary: Array of objects providing the "type" and "value" of each component in formatted string.

methods.name: resolvedOptions
methods.description:
Returns the formatting options the format object uses.

For more detail, see the MDN website about resolvedOptions.

methods.name: supportedLocalesOf
methods.summary: Static method indicating what locales are supported by DateTimeFormat from the given locale(s).
methods.description: For more detail, see the MDN website about supportedLocalesOf.

parameters.name: locales
parameters.summary: A string or array of strings providing BCP 47 locale identifiers to query.

returns.summary: Array containing a subset of the given locale strings supported by DateTimeFormat objects.

properties.name: constructor
properties.summary: Creates a new Intl.DateTimeFormat object with the given locale and formatting options.
properties.description:
# Syntax

new Intl.DateTimeFormat([locales[, options]])

# Parameters

  • locales: Global.String/Global.String[] (optional)

    The BCP 47 language and country code(s) to use for localized formatting. Can provide multiple locales where the best-supported locale will be favored in the order provided by the array. If parameter is not assigned, then the system may use the 'en-US' locale by default instead of the system's current locale. It's recommended to set this parameter using currentLocale.

  • options: DateTimeFormatOptions (optional)

    Provides settings indicating how a Date object should be formatted to a String.
